boardgame.name: Pax Pamir
boardgame.description: With the fall of Napoleon, the British East India Company plied its trade unchecked from the Cape of Good Hope to the markets of Hong Kong. India stood at the center of this sprawling imperial network, and the currents of empire ran through its ports, tying the Far East with European markets and awarding the British virtual control of the vast wealth of the subcontinent. However, the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;crown jewel_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; of the empire was far from secure._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Across the forests of Siberia and the steppes of Asia, the Russian Empire advanced at a rate exceeding even the pace of America's western pioneers. This expansionism by the world_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s largest nation loomed over British holdings in India, casting a longer shadow each year. In the buffer region of central Asia, surveyors, adventurers, industrialists and government agents crossed paths, all seeking to manipulate the byzantine local politics. There, in the shadow of the Pamir Mountains, the stage was set for a game that would define the limits of global power in the 19th century and the present day._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Pax Pamir, two to five players assume the role of Afghan tribal leaders navigating the winds of colonial power in _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The Great Game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. If either the Russian, British Empire, or Afghan is able to achieve supremacy, the player with the most influence in that empire wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ70: Pax Porfiriana (2012) Jim Gutt, Matt _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Phil Eklund
Episode 22 - New Games Delivered _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Host Autobiographies
Episode 85 -- Radical Ratings and Optimal Heaviness
Episode 9: Phil Eklund_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Adventures In Cube Repression
ET108: Verano del 69. De 1869. En Afganistán.
Heavy Cardboard Episode 37 – All the games!
The Good, the Board, and the North Sea: Episode 61
The Long View - Pax Pamir and Infamous Traffic

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Game: Pax Pamir (Sierra Madre Games) Condition: new in shrinkwrap Language: English Thanks in advance for ordering! See below for information on shipping, payment _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; cancellation. Payment: Bank transfer to an EU bank account using IBAN/BIC in advance (normally free of charge if your bank account is nominated in EURO) Paypal (add 3,- Euro to cover the fees. That should be the first choice for non-EU customers.) Pick up the game at my game store (no shipping cost) Shipping: always insured and with tracking Germany: 5,99€ for the first item card games or smaller boxes might be cheaper (please contact me beforehand) EU: 13,99€ up to 2kg 15,99€ up to 5kg 20,99€ up to 10kg Rest of the world: Please contact me before purchasing an item to clarify the shipping costs. I can offer discounts on shipping if multiple marketplace purchases are made. Returns and Cancellation: You may cancel your order without giving any reasons within 14 days after placing your order. Please contact spieleberatung@t-online.de and I will attempt to resolve the matter. Unopened copies of the game that are no longer wanted can be returned, but there is a 10% restocking fee payable of the item price and the buyer is responsible for the return shipping costs. Spieleberatung Frank Solnitzky Hainbuchenweg 1 36381 Schlüchtern Germany +49-06661-9115039 spieleberatung@t-online.de

Sierra Madre Games (SRM35) Pax Pamir is a card game for 2 to 5 players taking place in Afghanistan, 1823-1845. Assume the role of an Afghan tribal leader navigating the winds of colonial power in _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The Great Game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. If either the Russian or British Empire is able to achieve supremacy, you win if you have the most influence in that empire.

This uses the mechanisms of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Pax Porfiriana_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; to good effect to re-create the machinations of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Great Game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; between the British and Russian Empires over Afghanistan (aka the North-West Frontier). An impressive game that_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s also packed with history. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £18.33 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £3.10 (myHermes, takes 3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £8.34 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £6.95 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £11.25 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £10.40 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)
